summary.text: **LiqPass** provides retail traders with an insured gateway to high-leverage trading. Through a premium–payout model, risk-averse users can safely enter derivatives markets, expanding on-chain trading volume, increasing transaction fees, and attracting new users to the Base ecosystem.

**LiqPass** provides retail traders with an insured gateway to high-leverage trading. Through a premium–payout model, risk-averse users can safely enter derivatives markets, expanding on-chain trading volume, increasing transaction fees, and attracting new users to the Base ecosystem.

blocks.text: Currently, only fixed-amount liquidation insurance based on **principal and leverage** is provided. Users input principal and leverage when purchasing, and the system automatically calculates the premium and corresponding payout.

items: Connect wallet and log in;
Select exchange and fill in read-only information;
Input principal and leverage parameters;
System calculates premium and payout amount;
Policy becomes effective after payment.

blocks.text: LiqPass is a **passive claim mechanism** that does not actively monitor user trades. After liquidation, users submit order numbers or JSON files, and the system verifies order details and policy locally. If information matches, a payout is initiated; if automatic verification fails, users can submit screenshots and explanations for manual review.

Currently uses "local offline verification + on-chain summary" approach. Due to unstable access to OKX/Binance APIs from US-based cloud servers, only order summaries are used to generate **Merkle Root** for public on-chain verification.

The sole purpose of connecting a read-only API is to **verify the authenticity of a liquidation event**. When a user submits an order ID, the system checks—via read-only API—whether it exists, matches the parameters (symbol, leverage, settlement), contains a liquidation flag (`LIQUIDATION` / `ADL`), and belongs to the user.

items: Whether the order actually exists;
Whether time, symbol, leverage, settlement price, etc. match;
Whether it is indeed a liquidation (field contains `LIQUIDATION` or `ADL`);
Whether the order truly belongs to the user and is not forged.
A user may hold multiple exchange accounts, but only **one** needs to be connected for LiqPass;
All access is **read-only**, with no trading, withdrawal, or transfer rights;
We recommend **separating the main account from high-leverage accounts** for safety;
Examples:
If the main account trades on **OKX**, bind **Binance** as the insured account;
If mainly on **Binance**, bind **OKX**;
If active on both, use **Gate.io** or another small account.
Multiple high-leverage positions can be opened within the chosen exchange—no need to bind multiple platforms;
Data are accessed only when verifying claims—never continuously.

blocks.text: In short: LiqPass follows **“minimal authorization + account isolation”**, verifying truth while protecting user assets.

items: Client-side encryption; ciphertext-only storage;
No full trading history retained—only verification summaries;
Post-claim, a **Merkle Root** is committed on-chain;
Users can unbind and delete bindings at any time;
On-chain records contain no personally identifiable data.
